page.title: 02Housing
page.content: Families in this area live in a mixture of private and rented accomodation. In Delves Lane and Crookhall there are former Colliery bungalows now in the main privately owned due to mine closures in the 1960's. Recent Government legislation has encouraged many families to buy their Council houses. A good deal of revitalisation of Council and private property has taken place in all parts of this area and this is an on going operation.{Slum clearance}especially in Consett has led to the creation of space for new houses, which are currently under construction. Old peoples sheltered accomodation is available under direction of the local Council and the Anchor Housing Assoc. Blackhill has modern houses on land once overshadowed by the steelworks.
